title: Unable to log in bug Fix Attempts/Log
body:
IT'S FIXED! THANKS C9 HLGH!
I HAVE SOLVED THIS ISSUE. And apparently the guy above me did to at the same time.

Go to C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc and open the file "hosts" in notepad Then delete
"23.74.24.114 l3cdn.riotgames.com" from the bottom.
How to get over the "administrator" problem. Search for Notepad with your windows key, then right click and "Open as Administrator." Then open the file location "C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc" within Notepad and find hosts. (Also, change "Text Documentations (*.txt)" to "All Files (*.*)" if you can't find the file anymore)

You should be able to save now.

Since I seem to be the only one working towards a group brainstorm I created a separate discussion for it. I'll include everything that's been tried so far and we can bounce ideas around.

Red Post from the past stated:** Porocles (NA) ** - 3 days ago
This is an issue impacting quite a few players right now, and updates are being provided on the service status page. In the meantime, this workaround should resolve the issue:

Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Open "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" with notepad
Find the line:

gameflow-patcher-lock:

Delete this whole line
Save the file, restart your LoL Client - and you should be able to log in again.

If you received a leaverbuster as a result, hit us p in a support ticket. I can't make guarantees about having it removed, but we prefer review each case individually!

This is not working and we still have yet to receive a new red post regarding the issue.

Update: Did a full repair and it failed. https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115003681668 is where it sent me. Everything there checked out fine. I had just restarted before I initiated repair.
Update 2: Cleared everything in the LeagueClientSettings and even deleted the file entirely and still same issue.
My LeagueClientSettings now read like this:

install:
    gameflow-patcher-lock: null
    globals:
        locale: "en_US"
        region: "NA"
    last-valid-login-splash:
        theme: "vs"
        version: "1.17"
    licensesAgreedTo:
        BAB01EBF2B9BD188EB8076017D6808B5: null
    opt-in-has-migrated-v2: true
    opt-in-migration-attempts-remaining-v3: 2
    rso-auth:
        install-identifier: "9ee74c2d8057484581de93b644aacdef"
    telemetry:
        installation_id: "vpeGVw=="

Update 3: Reinstalling has been shown to not be a fix. You will be unable to automatically patch. Manual patching still being looked into. -Thanks to Dr Death

Update 4: Tried pasting in a friend's code from LeagueClientSettings, as he was able to log in, and tried again. The file still reverts back to the stunted form on client relaunch. Restarting and Shutting Down and rebooting computer still no changes. Will try full repair once more while brainstorming continues.

Update 5: Making changes to LeagueClientSettings and turning it into read only as well as keeping the file open during relaunch still prove to not work. Also changing null to true in the code does not fix either. -Thanks Noooob

Update 6: Hextech Repair tool ran with following options: 
Run Ping Test
Sync System Clock
Gather System and LoL Logs
Automatically Assign (DNS)
Add Firewall Exceptions (Enables firewall)
Disable Firewall
 
Not Successful in fixing issue. Trying With:
Force repatch

Not Successful in fixing issue.

Update 7: 
Used Hextech repair tool to Reinstall and once that was not successful I tried Clean Uninstall also selected. This was also not successful in resolving the issue. 

Also have the reinstall issue where the LoL website only offers the legacy client download instead of the new alpha download.

replies.body:
I HAVE SOLVED THIS ISSUE. And apparently the guy above me did to at the same time. 


Go to C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc and open the file "hosts" in notepad Then delete 
"23.74.24.114 l3cdn.riotgames.com" from the bottom.

It won't let me save, says I need administrator permission. Even when I run notepad as administrator, the "Hosts" file is nowhere to be found in that directory. Any tips? Saving to documents doesn't do shit.

The fixed work for me.

How to get over the "administrator" problem. Search for Notepad with your windows key, then right click and "Open as Administrator." Then open the file location "C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc" within Notepad and find hosts. (Also, change "Text Documentations (\*.txt)" to "All Files (\*.*)" if you can't find the file anymore)

You should be able to save now.

when i open notepad as admin and navigate to where the hosts file should be, it doesnt appear to exist. when i navigate to where the hosts file should be through the actual folders its right there but i cant save the changes. any thoughts on a workaround?

nevermind, i figured it out, but ill  put it here in case anyone else had my same problem. navigate to the "etc." but instead of opening hosts, right click and open the properties. move to the security tab, clicked the advanced button. it should open showing permissions. from this you can add a permission, in the select principal link there is a field at the bottom to "enter the object name". enter "users", capitalization did not matter for me, then click ok. that box should close and you should now be able to set permission for "users" (all users on pc). select "full control" and click ok. you should now be able to save the "hosts" file through notepad. to remove the permission simply go back into "hosts" properties on the security tab you can edit permissions, just remove the new permission you made. hope this helps someone else.
u dont have to do all that, navigate to folder using notepad then change search options from "text files" to "all files", you should be able to see hosts now. gl
This worked for me! Thank you very much.
Ayy it works now, Thanks a lot!
Change what kind of files you're searching for from "text documents" to "all file types" and it should show up.
thank you for the fix <3
this worked for me too thanks!!!

This worked for me, thank God. This is so stupid and should not be happening.
give this guy a cookie he did something riot wasnt able to ty mate{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
worked for me, ty man :*
my "hosts" file is just a example file and has no ips listed? so wtf? what do i do?
Same.
same

Here is everything I have tried and my thought process behind it:

1. The recommended fix. I noticed that the "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" file was being reverted after restarting the client.

2. Closing all instances of League (Task Manager), saving the "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" file while there are no instances of League (or any child background processes), and then reopening the client. The file reverted again.

3. Shutting down my computer, waiting for 30 seconds, powering it back on, and then modifying the "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" before accessing anything else. The file reverted again.

4. Changing the "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" filename to "LeagueClientSettings2.yaml" and restarting the client. The "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" was recreated with the "gameflow-patcher-lock: null" line.

5. Changing the "gameflow-patcher-lock: null" line to various other inputs such as "false", "true", and a series of numbers, and setting the file to Read Only.

6. Idling in the client. Some users reported that their issue was resolved after idling in the client for 5-15 minutes. I idled in the client for approximately 2 hours, with no changes.

7. Changing the Server my client was pointed at. This was a suggested fix in the parent "KNOWN ISSUE" board. I noticed an odd issue- I was getting stuck when pointed at the OCE server. My client said it needed to patch, but would get stuck in a permanent loop of trying to connect to the patching server when doing so (trying to reopen the client forced me to restart into the patcher after 10 seconds). I had to manually re-enter North America as my server in the "LeagueClientSettings.yaml" to get out of the loop. The settings successfully reverted back to NA, but I was still locked out of the account.

8. Initiating a Full Repair. The full repair failed, so I checked my hard drive to ensure there was enough space and retried it a second time. It failed again (likely because of the server connectivity issue).

9. Uninstalling and reinstalling. The local files were removed quickly and the installer worked fast, but whenever I attempt to open the League Client (old icon), the application (PVP.net Patcher Kernel) starts to idle. Allowing the system to continue the process results in an "HTTP Error: Failed to connect to RADS server".

10. Fixing the connection to the RADS server using old methods. First I changed to public DNS servers, and then I tried to access a fresh copy of the RADS Kernel executable file. I am unable to connect to l3cdn.riotgames.com to download any files (though I have not attempted it in so long that I am not sure it is still a working domain).

11. Manual patching. As far as I know, all manual patching was and still is done through the l3cdn.riotgames.com domain. I cannot access that domain or download any files off of it.

I think this is genuinely a patching server connectivity issue. People who are getting locked out of league have not received the fix that Riot pushed out at 10:40 AM on 17 June 2017, and are unable to access the server to fix it. I have no idea what's causing it and since it is server side, there is likely no fix that can be provided besides what already has.

Quick note- I don't think it is a problem that the legacy client is downloaded from the Riot website- the problem is that the patcher that usually initiates from the Legacy Client shortcut (as it has since they disabled the legacy client) is unable to connect to a server to get the new client and up-to-date patches.

I submitted a trouble ticket with basically this post verbatim, as well as all of the logs created by the Hextech Repair Tool. I'll let you guys know if anyone gets back to me, but I don't expect that to happen for a while.

Now the plot thickens. I was online and playing earlier tonight. I had a connection hiccup earlier and disconnected. Fixed connection and even finished my game and won. Finished the daily mission and everything. I've been experimenting with hextech repair tool trying to get it to work. Did Clean Uninstall and everything and still no dice.

I also just ran the Hextech Repair Tool (it looks like it automatically does a lot of the things I already did). Interestingly, even when running as an Administrator there are a couple of problems. First, even as an administrator, the time sync service fails. (I manually re-synced my system clock just in case, but there was no problem with it).

Second, the "Downloading Installer..." always fails. This is consistent with my hypothesis above- I believe that whatever server is responsible for providing updated files for the game is out of commission or running veeeerrrry slowly.

> [{quoted}](name=Axleration,realm=EUNE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=MxAAh0GN,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-06-18T20:06:01.268+0000)
>
> If the host file solution didn't work for you (i.e. your host file hadn't blacklisted Riot), there is another solution. And it's your DNS!
> 
> [Here is a stackexchange link on how to change your DNS.](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36668374/how-do-i-solve-the-server-dns-address-could-not-be-found-error-on-windows-10)
> 
> Hopefully this helped! :){{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

DNS is already set to Google.  I did all this stuff the first time I got the RADS error and the settings are the same, but now it still won't work for me.

I HAVE FIXED MY ISSUES. IF YOU ARE HAVING THIS ISSUE, READ BELOW FOR A POSSIBLE FIX.
Goto your C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc and open the file "hosts" in notepad. It may be empty, or it may contain RIOT-related IP addresses. Mine contained a riot IP address. This file is used to deny access to certain IPs, and I do not remember adding a Riot IP there, but there it was. I deleted it and saved the file, and VOILA. I am now able to log in.
I LUV YOU MAN, been beatin my head against a wall trying to fix this for the past 2 weeks THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU.

We've noticed there's been a weird issue with random players not being able to login. I recently put up a [**sticky post**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/hF8EV88W-were-unable-to-log-you-in-because-you-may-be-offline) detailing one of the most common fixes I've seen so far, and some of the steps here have been helping as well. There are a couple other possible solutions, but those can be a little tricky so we'd like to run through that one on one in a ticket if it comes to that point!

Swapping to LAN which acquiescently use ISP DNS leads to this problem.
Long story short, change your DNS. And the client sucks btw.

Dear god thank you, people below. I had all the same problems, and had tried everything. I checked my hosts file and did have that line in there, I'm pretty sure I added it back in the day when those RADS errors were going around. One think to note though, I had two "hosts" files in my drivers/etc folder, one listed as a "Calender" with a .ics extension, and the other as a plain file with no extension. Both had the troublesome DNS line in them, but removing it from the .ics file is what appeared to work. Thanks people!
I am also having this error. Really a Bummer to I had a 8 hour gaming session planned! =/
Using a VPN did not resolve this for me, if that helps add to the details at all.
